content:
Diagnosis
	1. Ileocecal valve neuroendocrine carcinoma T3N2M1
	Date of diagnosis
	January 2024

	Treatment aim
	Palliative

	Summary of completed treatment and relevant dates

	Surgery
	None indicated

	Chemotherapy
	1. Carboplatin/Etoposide commenced 15 Jan 2024
	2. Completed 4 cycles with stable disease 20 Mar 2024

	Clinical studies
	None

	Current disease status
	Stable disease on imaging

	Current issues
	Grade 3 thrombocytopenia, Grade 2 fatigue

	Summary of consultation
	Reviewed today following cycle 4 Carboplatin/Etoposide. CT shows stable disease in liver metastases and bone lesions. However, treatment has been complicated by cumulative myelosuppression with latest platelets 45 x 10^9/L and grade 2 fatigue affecting daily activities. Given high Ki67 of 80% and SSTR2 positivity, we have discussed switching to PRRT (Lutathera) therapy.

	Further investigations
	Gallium-68 DOTATATE PET-CT booked for 15 Apr 2024

	Medication prescribed
	None

	Follow up
	Next oncology follow up in 2 weeks with PET-CT results

	Required GP actions
	Weekly FBC monitoring

	Summary of information given to patient
	Discussed rationale for treatment change and PRRT procedure. Information leaflet provided.

cancer_timeline.value: Completed 4 cycles Carboplatin/Etoposide with stable disease

patient_facts.value: CT shows stable disease in liver metastases and bone lesions

status_updates.value: Metastatic ileocecal neuroendocrine carcinoma with stable disease after 4 cycles chemotherapy but complicated by cumulative myelosuppression
Planning switch from chemotherapy to PRRT (Lutathera) therapy
Gallium-68 DOTATATE PET-CT booked for 15 Apr 2024
Review in 2 weeks with PET-CT results
